Text: Re In re MV PACIFIC VIRGO Cc Please find herewith a recap of my observations relating to Mitsubishis demurrage claim which does not take the outcome of the liability question icw the rejection of the cargo by receivers at Batangas into account Claim is time barred ECTS clause Ownersowners brokers did not return signed original of charterparty within days from completion of discharge cod notwithstanding that the original and duplicate were sent to them on which is days after cod case law Commercial Court Obo Venture Start laytime at Elang ECTS clauses e and Notice of Readiness NOR shall not be tendered before h on first day of laydays In addition Enron is entitled to a complete hours notice time as the noticetime entitlement is unqualified contrary to clause of the Asbatankvoy CP Deduction h m Slow loading Elang ECTS clause b Shore lodged Letter of Protest stating that Terminal loading rate is mhr and vessel was unable to load at a rate greater than mhr However we do not know what the max receiving rate of the vessel is Moreover vessel has manifolds and shore only connected x arm Start laytime at Koh Sichang ECTS clauses e and As per point above Deduction h m Excess pumping time at Koh Sichang ECTS clause Vessel neither discharged this part cargo in h m based on hours for entire cargo as warranted nor did she maintain a pressure of psi at manifold The vessel discharged this part of cargo in h m However shore had imposed pressure and rate restrictions on vessel Taking these restrictions into consideration the vessel in breach of owners pumping warranty used h m in excess of what she should have used Deduction h m Bad weather related port closure at Batangas ECTS clause h and f Agents reported that all terminals in Batangas were closed for berthing due high winds during the first h from arrival on to According to clause h the delay in berthing resulting from weather conditions counts at onehalf of such time Deduction h m h h In the alternative we may be able to fully deduct the h delay pursuant to clause f if there is a local law or regulation we can rely on to except this delay Eric Tan has requested a copy of the port regulations Start laytime at Yosu clause of Asbatankvoy CP a NOR was allegedly tendered on at h However NOR attached to claim shows that it was received on at h when vessel all fast in berth Moreover the NOR is dated As per clause laytime shall only start hours after receipt of notice by chartererstheir agents I do not believe that Enron Spore received an NOR by telex They only received a telex from their nominated agents Samsun on at h with the vessels arrival times including the EOSP and NOR tendered time at h b Alternatively vessel anchored at waiting place on at h but tendered NOR at EOSP h or on arrival pilot station h As per clause the NOR has to be tendered on arrival at customary anchorage As a result the NOR tendered by master was given prematurely and at the wrong place This renders the NOR invalid As the master did not retender a fresh NOR when the vessel arrived at customary anchorage laytime shall not commence if at all until the commencement of discharge case law High Court Agamemnon Excess pumping time at Yosu ECTS clause Vessel neither discharged this part cargo in h m based on hours for entire cargo nor did she maintain the max allowable shore pressure of kgcm less than psi at manifold The vessel discharged this part of cargo in h m Deduction h m Please let me know if you have any questions B regards Wietze Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From Paul Henking To Wietze CT cc Richard B CT Alan CT Harry M CT Michael A CT Matthias CT Eric CT ENRON ENRON Becky NRON Britt NRON Subject Re In re MV PACIFIC VIRGO wietze sorry to come back to you on this matter but appreciate your input once again from your msg of nov seems worse case is we owe about but could be better would appreciate if you could put together a recap of the various positions for brittdavid including possibiliy of the time bar whereby it could be zero so they can determine best position if as you say we may have a strong arguement at the time bar my suggestion would be that david discuss this possibility with mitsubishis lawyers to try to determine a reaction if possible to that position we can always agree to pay a lower amount later as usual thanks to copy us on whatever is sent so we have a copy for the files also thanks again for your help best regards From Britt NRON on PM CST To Richard B CT Alan CT Harry M CT Michael A CT Matthias CT Paul CT Eric CT cc Becky NRON Subject In re MV PACIFIC VIRGO Mitsubishi has just agreed to have Mr Hamblen one of the arbitrators that we proposed appointed in this matter David Best will follow up with Mr Hamblen with this David will also go forward with negotiating the withoutprejudice payment of Mitsubishis freight and demurrage claim the latter payment being based on what our demurrage department thinks it is really worthPaul I need to get with you on this as I had previously authorized him to do Mitsubishi has been advised of the shelflife issue and is being pressed by its solicitors for a reply to our suggestion that the joint survey take place in the UK Mitsubishi advises their solicitors that they will revert as soon as possible regarding this I will continue to keep you advised Britt
